physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman
 dressed in a coat and skirt
 standing by a fence gate. Behind the fence
 there is a field. In the fistance
 there are several large buildings amongst trees. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver  by fence
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman, dressed in a coat and skirt, standing by a fence gate. Behind the fence, there is a field. In the fistance, there are several large buildings amongst trees. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
